column4: I followed the step-by-step instructions given at ubuntu.com for both cd and dvd installation and both discs freeze when an option is chosen at the "try ubuntu, install ubuntu" menu (yes, I've tried them all on both the cd and dvd). I don't know how to proceed, I'd really like to install ubuntu on its own partition(s)...
How long do you wait for the disk to go to the desktop? It can take up to 2 minutes sometimes, depending on the hardware.
What are your system specifications? Also, have you tried using the USB installation?
I say try using the USB install. If you don't have a USB disk, I suggest picking one up. It's an overall better method.
